meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a peg again.
meanings.sent1: She was repegging the tent after it fell down.
meanings.sent2: He always repegged the loose boards on the fence.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel kept repegging the acorns in the ground for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The gardener repegged the wilting plants to revive them.
meanings.sent5: Repegging the picture frame made it hang straight again.

meanings.definition: The act of reattaching a peg.
meanings.sent1: The repegging of the clothesline was necessary after the storm.
meanings.sent2: She heard the repegging of the tent in the campsite.
meanings.sent3: The repegging of the puzzle pieces was a challenge for the kids.
meanings.sent4: The repegging of the broken chair leg saved it from being thrown away.
meanings.sent5: The repegging of the bookshelf made it sturdy once more.

meanings.definition: The process of adjusting or resetting a peg.
meanings.sent1: The repegging of the guitar strings improved the sound.
meanings.sent2: He observed the repegging of the wobbly table leg.
meanings.sent3: The repegging of the clock hands made time go backwards!
meanings.sent4: She found joy in the repegging of the old wooden toys.
meanings.sent5: The repegging of the door latch fixed the squeaking noise.
